changes_made: Added responsive padding with breakpoints: xs: 2, sm: 3
Implemented responsive grid layout: xs: 1fr, sm: 2 columns, md: 4 columns
Added responsive typography sizing for h4 heading and body text
Made WorkloadCalendar responsive with display: { xs: 'none', lg: 'block' }
Implemented responsive flex layout for header section with column/row direction changes
Added responsive spacing and alignment for filter chips
Updated Grid container spacing with responsive values
Adjusted Grid item breakpoints from xs={12} md={6} to xs={12} sm={6}

patterns_discovered.description: Consistent use of MUI's breakpoint system (xs, sm, md, lg) across multiple sx properties
Mobile layouts defined first (xs breakpoint) with progressively enhanced layouts for larger screens
Using display property with breakpoints to show/hide components at specific screen sizes
Font sizes adjusted with breakpoints to maintain readability across devices

gotchas_discovered.description: WorkloadCalendar component is hidden on mobile/tablet (xs, sm, md) and only displayed on lg breakpoint. May affect UX on smaller devices if this component is important.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify that calendar functionality is available through alternative means on smaller screens

gotchas_discovered.description: Changed from md={6} to sm={6}, causing cards to appear 2-per-row starting at tablet size instead of medium screens. Ensure this doesn't cause layout crowding on smaller tablets.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Test on various tablet sizes to confirm layout acceptability

gotchas_discovered.description: Header section changes from row to column layout on mobile with different alignment (flex-start vs center). Gap property added to handle spacing in column mode.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Test mobile layout to ensure spacing and alignment look correct in stacked view

approach_outcome.strategy: Systematic responsive design enhancement using MUI breakpoint system
approach_outcome.implementation_method: Modified sx properties with breakpoint objects to provide responsive values for layout, spacing, and typography
key_decisions: Used mobile-first approach with xs breakpoint as base
Hid large components (WorkloadCalendar) on smaller screens for better UX
Maintained consistent spacing ratios across breakpoints (xs: 2, sm: 3)
Adjusted typography sizing proportionally across screen sizes
approach_outcome.testing_recommendations: Manual testing across: mobile (xs), tablet (sm, md), desktop (lg, xl)

recommendations.recommendation: Test responsive layouts on actual devices/emulators for xs, sm, md, and lg breakpoints to verify visual alignment and spacing
Verify that hidden components (display: none) on mobile are not critical to user interactions; consider alternative layouts rather than hiding functionality
Consider lazy-loading WorkloadCalendar component since it's hidden on smaller screens, to improve mobile performance
Document the responsive breakpoint strategy used here for consistent application across other pages in the application
Consider alternative UX patterns for WorkloadCalendar on mobile (e.g., modal, drawer, or simplified view) rather than complete hiding
